ThingDef.label: Ellis-Jennings Rifle
ThingDef.description: Ellis-Jennings. Repeating flintlock rifle, Uses superimposed loads that can be individually selected by moving the hammer mechanism. This model uses Chambers patented bullets, allowing for a rapid burst shot. \n"To be prepared for war is one of the most effectual means of preserving peace."\n-Washington

ThingDef.label: East India Brown Bess
ThingDef.description:
East India Brown Bess conversion. Heavy caliber flintlock musket converted to use percussion caps, packs a hard-hitting punch despite its old age. A remnant of broken empires. 
Though her sight was not long and her weight was not small,
Yet her actions were winning, her language was clear;
And everyone bowed as she opened the ball
On the arm of some high-gaitered, grim grenadier.
Half Europe admitted the striking success
Of the dances and routs that were given by Brown Bess.

ThingDef.label: Plains Marksman Rifle
ThingDef.description: Plains Rifle. 50-caliber target rifle with superimposed chambers, giving two shots in one barrel. This rifle also features "Side Slapper" hammers on either side, improving visibility. Highly accurate tangent sights allow for pinpoint shooting, if you miss it’s not the gun’s fault, it’s your own.\n\nManifest your Destiny

ThingDef.label: 1842 Springfield Musket
ThingDef.description:
Springfield 1842 Short. The ultimate development of the smothbore musket. Made obsolete by the development of the fast loading rifle, the musket has a limited range and accuracy, but was kept in service due to the guns ability to fire a powerful buckshot load, doing massive damage at close range. Its bayonet can also be used to great affect in melee engagements.

We love the land of liberty, its law we do revere, But the divil take the nobility
-Unknown Irish volunteer

ThingDef.label: Harmonica Rifle
ThingDef.description:
Harmonica Rifle. The Jonathan Browning style Harmonica Rifle uses five chambers in a solid sliding block. This allows the gun to be both fired and reloaded rapidly.

“In a world filled with misery and uncertainty, it is a great comfort to know that, in the end, there is light in the darkness.”
– Joshua Graham

ThingDef.label: Mississippi-Merrill Rifle
ThingDef.description:
Mississippi-Merrill Rife. The Mississippi Rife was developed in 1841 as an American Jäger rifle, and was used extensively during the Mexican-American war, later converted to the new .58 Mini Ball standard. The Merrill system was an breech loading conversion accepted for the rifle, letting the gun load much faster then the old muzzle loading method.

"War is hell. You cannot qualify war in harsher terms than I will. War is cruelty, and you cannot refine it."
-General Sherman

ThingDef.label: Kammerlader
ThingDef.description: Kammerlader M/1855. Nordic beach-loading rifle that uses a unique under hammer system, allowing for a clean sightline and good accuracy at range. \n"Hands off Norway, King!"

ThingDef.label: 1861 Springfield Rifle
ThingDef.description:
Springfield 1861 Rife. Firing conical Minié ball as standard, its accuracy surpasses that of the old smooth-bore musket. Obsolete compared to breach-loading designs, the muzzle-loader was kept in production due to the significantly lower price point. An omnipresent weapon.

His truth is marching on.

ThingDef.description: 2-Bore Musket, Used for hunting flocks waterfowl by sending a large amount of shot over a wide area.

ThingDef.label: M1903 Springfield
ThingDef.description: Ancient bolt-action rifle. Fires a full-power rifle cartridge and is a popular choice in the rimworlds due to its shear firepower and simplicity. Comes equipped with a scope.
